desc_eng: A five-year grant that gives prominent researchers the opportunity to strengthen their position as independent researchers.
desc_sv: Ett femårigt anslag som ger framstående forskare möjligheten att stärka sin position som självständiga forskare.
applicant_eng: Individual researcher who is employed at a Swedish University. If the grant is awarded, the recipient must be employed by the grant manager at the start of the grant and for the duration of the grant period. This employment must be at least 50% full time employment. Applicants do not have to be employed by the grant manager at the time of making the application. Your doctoral degree should be between 7 and 12 years old. The degree may be up to 24 months older to account for time used for sick and parental leave, AT/ST service and military service.
applicant_sv: Enskild forskare som är anställd vid svenskt lärosäte. Om bidrag beviljas ska mottagaren vara anställd av anslagsförvaltaren när bidragsperioden börjar och sedan under hela bidragsperioden. Anställningen ska omfatta minst 50 procent av en heltidsanställning. Sökande behöver inte vara anställd av anslagsförvaltaren vid ansökningstillfället. Din doktorsexamen måste var 7-12 år. Avräkningsbar tid kan godkännas med totalt 24 månader för sjuk- och föräldraledighet, AT/ST-tjänstgöring och militärtjänstgöring.
amount_eng: 2 200 000 SEK per year, including indirect costs

title_eng: Project grant for international research collaboration within antimicrobial resistance (JPIAMR)
title_sv: Project grant for international research collaboration within antimicrobial resistance (JPIAMR)
desc_eng: The purpose of the grant is to support international collaboration within the Joint Programming Initiative on Antimicrobial Resistance (JPIAMR). Sweden, via the Swedish Research Council, the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency, and Vinnova is one of the 17 countries taking part in the call.
desc_sv: Syftet med bidraget är att stödja internationella samarbeten inom Joint Programming Initiative on Antimicrobial Resistance (JPIAMR) som undersöker åtgärdsstrategier för att förhindra utveckling och överföring av infektioner orsakade av antimikrobiell resistens. Sverige är via Vetenskapsrådet, SIDA och Vinnova, ett av de 17 länder som deltar i JPIAMR-utlysningen.

title_eng: International post doc grant within medicine and health (spring call)
title_sv: Internationell postdok inom medicin och hälsa (vårens utlysning)
desc_eng: The purpose of the grant is to give researchers recently awarded a doctoral degree from a Swedish higher education institution (HEI) the opportunity to expand their networks and their competences by working abroad under secure employment conditions. The grant is also intended to promote the quality and renewal of Swedish research.
desc_sv: Syftet med bidraget är att ge forskare som nyligen avlagt doktorsexamen vid svenskt universitet eller högskola möjlighet att utöka sitt nätverk och sin kompetens genom att arbeta utomlands under trygga anställningsformer. Bidraget ska också premiera den svenska forskningens kvalitet och förnyelse.
applicant_eng: Individual researcher who completed a doctoral degree no more than 2 years ago, or who will have completed a doctoral degree before the start of the grant period, that is no later than 30 June 2022.
applicant_sv: Enskild forskare som avlagt doktorsexamen för högst 2 år sedan eller som kommer att ha avlagt examen innan bidragsperiodens start, det vill säga senast den 30 juni 2022.
participating_res_eng: No other researchers may be invited to join the application
participating_res_sv: Inga forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan
amount_eng: 1 150 000 SEK per year. A further total of 50 000 SEK per year may be applied for, for one or more accompanying family members
amount_sv: 1 150 000 kronor/år. Ytterligare 50 000 kronor per år kan sökas för en eller flera medföljande familjemedlemmar
budget_framework_eng: In addition to the ordinary budgetary framework, a call is issued for at least 1 grant in psychiatry focusing on psychiatric involuntary care and forensic psychiatry, and at least 1 grant in antibiotics and antimicrobial resistance
budget_framework_sv: Utöver ordinarie budgetram utlyses minst 1 bidrag inom psykiatri med inriktning psykiatrisk tvångsvård och rättspsykiatri och minst 1 bidrag inom antibiotika och antimikrobiell resistens
award_date_eng: No later than the beginning of June 2022

title_eng: Project grant for research into post-COVID
desc_eng: The purpose of the project grant is to fund research into post-infectious conditions with remaining or late-onset symptoms following COVID-19 infection (post-COVID).
desc_sv: Syftet med projektbidraget är att finansiera forskning om postinfektiöst tillstånd med kvarstående eller sena symptom efter genomgången covid-19 (postcovid).
participating_res_eng: Up to 6 other researchers may be invited to join the application
participating_res_sv: Upp till 6 forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan
period_eng: 1–4 years. The entire grant amount will be paid out in 2021
amount_eng: Minimum 400 000 SEK per year, maximum 2 500 000 SEK per year
amount_sv: Minst 400 000 kronor per år, max 2 500 000 kronor per år
award_date_eng: No later than the beginning of December 2021

title_eng: Proof of concept within the infection area
desc_eng: The purpose of the grant is to bridge the gap between basic research and commercialisation of research results within the infection area. The proof of concept grant offers persons who are receiving or have received a grant from the Swedish Research Council the opportunity to further develop their research results. This is done by verifying the usability and suitability of a new method, product or process developed from a previous research project and carrying out activities that prepare for innovation or commercialisation.
desc_sv: Syftet med bidraget är att överbrygga gapet mellan grundforskning och nyttiggörande eller kommersialisering av forskningsresultat inom infektionsområdet. Proof of concept ger dig som har eller har haft bidrag från Vetenskapsrådet möjlighet att vidareutveckla dina forskningsresultat. Detta genom att verifiera användbarhet och lämplighet av en ny metod, produkt eller process som utvecklats från ett tidigare forskningsprojekt samt genomföra aktiviteter som förbereder för innovation eller kommersialisering.
applicant_eng: Individual researcher who is receiving or has received a grant from the Swedish Research Council with a grant period ending in 2019, 2020 or 2021.
applicant_sv: Enskild forskare som har varit eller är innehavare av (projektledare för) bidrag från Vetenskapsrådet med bidragsperiod som slutar 2019, 2020 eller 2021.
participating_res_eng: Up to 6 other researchers may be invited to join the application
participating_res_sv: Upp till 6 forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan
amount_eng: Minimum 500 000 SEK in total, maximum 2 000 000 SEK in total
amount_sv: Minst 500 000 kronor totalt, max 2 000 000 kronor totalt
budget_framework_eng: 10 million SEK for the area of antimicrobial resistance, plus 10 million SEM for the area of viruses and pandemics
budget_framework_sv: 10 miljoner för området antimikrobiell resistens, plus 10 miljoner för området virus och pandemier
award_date_eng: No later than the beginning of December 2021

title_eng: FAIR and open data sharing in support to European preparedness for COVID-19 and other infectious diseases (HORIZON-INFRA-2021-EMERGENCY-01)
title_sv: FAIR och öppen datadelning till stöd för europeisk beredskap för covid-19 och andra infektionssjukdomar (HORIZON-INFRA-2021-EMERGENCY-01)
desc_eng: This action responds to the need to enable researchers, health care professionals and society at large to share, access, analyse, link and process research data and other research digital objects across disciplines and national borders in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. As seen with other infectious disease outbreaks, such as haemorrhagic fevers, COVID-19 will likely remain a societal challenge beyond the immediate outbreak, considering its destructive and disruptive impact on healthcare systems and the economy. In addition to the ongoing health threat from SARS-CoV-2, the risk from other emerging pathogens also persists, which will also require similar concerted action to identify and characterise infections with pandemic potential, and enable rapid public health action to mitigate health and societal impact. Provision of comprehensive open data on infectious agents and diseases during outbreaks support evidence-based quality assessment - across scientific, medical, public health and policy domains and promotes reproducibility of research outcomes. Particular importance should be placed on mobilising raw viral sequences and identifying and monitoring the spread of SARS-CoV-2 variants. European readiness for future pandemics is of utmost importance and should be addressed to ensure the preparedness of infrastructure building on already existing frameworks for broader use such as the EOSC.
desc_sv: This action responds to the need to enable researchers, health care professionals and society at large to share, access, analyse, link and process research data and other research digital objects across disciplines and national borders in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. As seen with other infectious disease outbreaks, such as haemorrhagic fevers, COVID-19 will likely remain a societal challenge beyond the immediate outbreak, considering its destructive and disruptive impact on healthcare systems and the economy. In addition to the ongoing health threat from SARS-CoV-2, the risk from other emerging pathogens also persists, which will also require similar concerted action to identify and characterise infections with pandemic potential, and enable rapid public health action to mitigate health and societal impact. Provision of comprehensive open data on infectious agents and diseases during outbreaks support evidence-based quality assessment - across scientific, medical, public health and policy domains and promotes reproducibility of research outcomes. Particular importance should be placed on mobilising raw viral sequences and identifying and monitoring the spread of SARS-CoV-2 variants. European readiness for future pandemics is of utmost importance and should be addressed to ensure the preparedness of infrastructure building on already existing frameworks for broader use such as the EOSC.

title_eng: Research infrastructure services for rapid research responses to COVID-19 and other infectious disease epidemics (HORIZON-INFRA-2021-EMERGENCY-02
title_sv: Forskningsinfrastrukturtjänster för snabba forskningssvar på covid-19 och andra infektionssjukdomsepidemier (HORIZON-INFRA-2021-EMERGENCY-02)
desc_eng: Proposals under this action, will integrate research infrastructure services to form a comprehensive and inclusive portfolio to support research in response to infectious disease epidemics or underpinning respective forefront research in the field. As a first immediate challenge, the delivered services should support research targeting newly emerging SARS-Cov-2 variants and addressing the on-going COVID-19 pandemic. Proposals will support the provision of trans-national and/or virtual access to researchers as well as training for using the infrastructures, and activities to improve, customise and integrate the services the infrastructures provide, so as to facilitate and integrate the access procedures and to further develop the remote or virtual provision of services.
desc_sv: Proposals under this action, will integrate research infrastructure services to form a comprehensive and inclusive portfolio to support research in response to infectious disease epidemics or underpinning respective forefront research in the field. As a first immediate challenge, the delivered services should support research targeting newly emerging SARS-Cov-2 variants and addressing the on-going COVID-19 pandemic. Proposals will support the provision of trans-national and/or virtual access to researchers as well as training for using the infrastructures, and activities to improve, customise and integrate the services the infrastructures provide, so as to facilitate and integrate the access procedures and to further develop the remote or virtual provision of services.

title_eng: Vaccines & therapeutic clinical trials to boost COVID-19 prevention and treatment
title_sv: Vacciner och kliniska behandlingsstudier för att förstärka förebyggande och behandling av covid-19.
desc_eng: Proposals submitted under this expression of interest should aim to further develop promising therapeutic or prophylactic candidates against SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19. The vaccine/treatment candidates should have completed preclinical development, including animal studies, and be ready to enter clinical evaluation in Phase I or II studies. Applicants should have addressed the current viral variants of concern in their pre-clinical work, and/or anticipated the emergence of new variants. Proposals should include a summary of results obtained in the concluded studies (pre-clinical and/or Phase I). Proposals are also expected to include assurances on sufficient and timely access to GMP production of the compound(s) to be trialled (the costs of which can be included in the proposal). In addition, options to upscale production for subsequent development beyond the activities for which funding is requested, should be indicated as appropriate.
desc_sv: Proposals submitted under this expression of interest should aim to further develop promising therapeutic or prophylactic candidates against SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19. The vaccine/treatment candidates should have completed preclinical development, including animal studies, and be ready to enter clinical evaluation in Phase I or II studies. Applicants should have addressed the current viral variants of concern in their pre-clinical work, and/or anticipated the emergence of new variants. Proposals should include a summary of results obtained in the concluded studies (pre-clinical and/or Phase I). Proposals are also expected to include assurances on sufficient and timely access to GMP production of the compound(s) to be trialled (the costs of which can be included in the proposal). In addition, options to upscale production for subsequent development beyond the activities for which funding is requested, should be indicated as appropriate.

title_eng: Cohorts united against COVID-19 variants of concern
title_sv: Förenade kohorter mot olika varianter av SARS-CoV-2
desc_eng: Proposals submitted under this expression of interest are expected to build on existing large-scale, multi-centre, regional or international cohorts worldwide and/or establish new ones linked to those. These cohorts should aim to rapidly advance the knowledge on SARS-CoV-2 and its emerging variants of concern, with the aim of developing evidence-based strategic and robust recommendations for the effective control and prevention of COVID-19 infection. The regional or international cohort(s) should allow to rapidly and consistently provide estimations on the occurrence and spread of emerging variants of concern in different parts of the world. They should contribute to a better understanding of their transmissibility, virulence and pathogenicity.
desc_sv: Proposals submitted under this expression of interest are expected to build on existing large-scale, multi-centre, regional or international cohorts worldwide and/or establish new ones linked to those. These cohorts should aim to rapidly advance the knowledge on SARS-CoV-2 and its emerging variants of concern, with the aim of developing evidence-based strategic and robust recommendations for the effective control and prevention of COVID-19 infection. The regional or international cohort(s) should allow to rapidly and consistently provide estimations on the occurrence and spread of emerging variants of concern in different parts of the world. They should contribute to a better understanding of their transmissibility, virulence and pathogenicity.

title_eng: Research environment grant for follow-up studies of COVID-19 vaccines
title_sv: Bidrag till forskningsmiljö för uppföljningsstudier av covid-19-vaccin
desc_eng: The purpose of the grant is to give researchers the opportunity to collaborate nationally to conduct follow-up studies of COVID-19 vaccine that are justified by the needs of health and medical care and that contribute to a permanent infrastructure for future follow-up studies.
desc_sv: Syftet med bidraget är att ge forskare möjlighet att i nationell samverkan genomföra uppföljningsstudier av covid-19-vaccin som är motiverade av hälso- och sjukvårdens behov och som bidrar till en beständig infrastruktur för framtida uppföljningsstudier.
applicant_eng: Individual researcher with a clinical position covering a minimum of 20 per cent of a full-time equivalent
applicant_sv: Enskild forskare som innehar klinisk tjänstgöring med en omfattning av minst 20 procent av en heltidsanställning
participating_res_eng: A minimum of 3 and maximum of 10 researchers shall be invited to join the application
participating_res_sv: Minst 3 och högst 10 forskare ska bjudas in att medverka i ansökan
period_eng: 3–4 years. The entire grant amount will be paid out in 2021
amount_eng: Minimum 10 million SEK in total, maximum 25 million SEK in total
amount_sv: Minst 10 miljoner kronor totalt, max 25 miljoner kronor totalt
budget_framework_eng: A total of approximately 50 million SEK
award_date_eng: No later than end of June 2021

title_eng: Project grant for research on viruses and virus-caused disease conditions
title_sv: Projektbidrag inom virus och virusorsakade sjukdomstillstånd
desc_eng: The purpose is to give researchers the freedom to formulate their own research ideas, methods and implementation, and to solve a defined research task within a limited period of time. The focus of this call is on long-term research into basic virology and fundamental disease mechanisms caused by viruses.
desc_sv: Syftet är att ge forskare frihet att själva formulera forskningsidé, metod och utförande, samt att lösa en definierad forskningsuppgift inom en begränsad tid. Inriktningen för detta bidrag syftar till långsiktig forskning inom basal virologisk forskning och grundläggande sjukdomsmekanismer som förorsakas av virus.
participating_res_eng: Up to 6 other researchers may be invited to join the application.
participating_res_sv: Upp till 6 andra forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan.
amount_eng: Minimum 400 000 SEK per year, Maximum 2 500 000 SEK per year
amount_sv: Minst 400 000 kronor per år, max 2 500 000 kronor per år.
budget_framework_eng: A total of approximately 50 million SEK.
award_date_eng: No later than the end of November 2021

title_eng: Research project grant within medicine and health
desc_eng: The purpose of the project grant is to give researchers the freedom to formulate their own research idea, method and implementation, and to solve a specific research task within a limited period.
desc_sv: Syftet med projektbidraget är att du som forskare ges frihet att själv formulera forskningsidé, metod och utförande, samt att lösa en definierad forskningsuppgift inom en begränsad tid.
participating_res_eng: Up to 6 other researchers may be invited to join the application.
participating_res_sv: Upp till 6 andra forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan.
amount_eng: Minimum 400 000 SEK per year, Maximum 2 500 000 SEK per year
amount_sv: Minst 400 000 kronor per år, max 2 500 000 kronor per år.
award_date_eng: No later than the end of November 2021

title_eng: Starting grant within medicine and health
desc_eng: The purpose of the grant is to give junior researchers the opportunity to establish themselves as independent researchers in Sweden.
desc_sv: Syftet med bidraget är att ge dig som junior forskare möjlighet att etablera dig som självständig forskare i Sverige.
applicant_eng: Individual researcher who has completed a doctoral degree more than 2 years ago and up to 7 years ago.
applicant_sv: Enskild forskare som avlagt doktorsexamen för mer än 2 och högst 7 år sedan.
participating_res_eng: No participating researchers may be invited to join the application.
participating_res_sv: Inga andra forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan.
budget_framework_eng: Approximately 30 grants will be awarded under the call
budget_framework_sv: Cirka 30 bidrag kommer att beviljas inom utlysningen.
award_date_eng: No later than the beginning of November 2021

title_eng: Grant for half-time research position in a clinical environment
title_sv: Bidrag till anställning som forskare på halvtid i klinisk miljö
desc_eng: The purpose of the grant is to give clinically active persons the opportunity to conduct research on a half-time basis in parallel with developing their clinical skills. The aim is to reinforce and renew medical and clinical research.
desc_sv: Syftet med bidraget är att du som är kliniskt verksam ges möjlighet att bedriva forskning på halvtid parallellt med att du utvecklar din kliniska kompetens. Detta för att stärka och förnya den medicinska och kliniska forskningen.
applicant_eng: Individual researcher who has completed a doctoral degree no more than 10 years ago.
applicant_sv: Enskild forskare som avlagt doktorsexamen för högst 10 år sedan
participating_res_eng: No participating researchers may be invited to join the application.
participating_res_sv: Inga andra forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan.
period_eng: 3 years (with the opportunity of a 3 year extension)
period_sv: 3 år (med möjlighet till förlängning med ytterligare 3 år)
budget_framework_eng: Up to three grants may be funded under the call.
budget_framework_sv: Upp till tre bidrag kan beviljas inom utlysningen.
award_date_eng: No later than the beginning of November 2021

title_eng: Swedish Research Council: Grant for half-time research within healthcare sciences
title_sv: Bidrag till forskningstid på halvtid inom vårdforskning
desc_eng: The purpose of the grant is to give healthcare professionals the opportunity to conduct research on a half-time basis and to establish themselves as independent researchers in parallel with developing their professional competence. The call aims to promote international collaboration and mobility within Sweden.
desc_sv: Syftet med bidraget är att att ge personer verksamma inom vårdyrken möjlighet att bedriva forskning på halvtid och etablera sig som självständiga forskare parallellt med att de utvecklar sin yrkeskompetens. Utlysningen vill främja internationellt samarbete och mobilitet inom Sverige.
applicant_eng: Individual researcher who has completed a doctoral degree no more than 10 years ago.
applicant_sv: Enskild forskare som avlagt doktorsexamen för högst 10 år sedan.
participating_res_eng: No participating researchers may be invited to join the application.
participating_res_sv: Inga andra forskare kan bjudas in att medverka i ansökan.
budget_framework_eng: Up to 5 grants may be funded under the call.
budget_framework_sv: Upp till 5 bidrag kan beviljas inom utlysningen
award_date_eng: No later than the beginning of November 2021

desc_eng: SciLifeLab is opening five calls for proposals on COVID-19 research that are announced at the same time to help scientists plan their efforts in light of the funding possibilities. Two calls represent the continuation of the ongoing KAW-supported SciLifeLab coordinated COVID-19 research program initiated in the spring of 2020. One call is specifically targeting effects of vaccination. One call will focus on suggestions (letter of intent) for ideas on pandemic preparedness and one on suggestions for data-driven research on COVID-19 (letter of intent).
desc_sv: SciLifeLab is opening five calls for proposals on COVID-19 research that are announced at the same time to help scientists plan their efforts in light of the funding possibilities. Two calls represent the continuation of the ongoing KAW-supported SciLifeLab coordinated COVID-19 research program initiated in the spring of 2020. One call is specifically targeting effects of vaccination. One call will focus on suggestions (letter of intent) for ideas on pandemic preparedness and one on suggestions for data-driven research on COVID-19 (letter of intent).
